schema.title: Create a React Application
schema.description: Create a React application for Nx.

examples.description: Use class components instead of functional components

directory.description: The directory of the new application.
directory.x-prompt: Which directory do you want to create the application in?

style.description: The file extension to be used for style files.

x-prompt.message: Which stylesheet format would you like to use?

routing.x-prompt: Would you like to add React Router to this application?

skipNxJson.description: Skip updating `nx.json` with default options based on values provided to this app.

bundler.x-prompt: Which bundler do you want to use to build the application?

linter.description: The tool to use for running lint checks.
linter.x-prompt: Which linter would you like to use?

unitTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for unit tests.
unitTestRunner.x-prompt: What unit test runner should be used?

inSourceTests.description: When using Vitest, separate spec files will not be generated and instead will be included within the source files. Read more on the Vitest docs site: https://vitest.dev/guide/in-source.html

e2eTestRunner.description: Test runner to use for end to end (E2E) tests.
e2eTestRunner.x-prompt: Which E2E test runner would you like to use?

tags.description: Add tags to the application (used for linting).

classComponent.description: Use class components instead of functional component.

js.description: Generate JavaScript files rather than TypeScript files.

globalCss.description: Default is `false`. When `true`, the component is generated with `*.css`/`*.scss` instead of `*.module.css`/`*.module.scss`.

strict.description: Creates an application with strict mode and strict type checking.

setParserOptionsProject.description: Whether or not to configure the ESLint `parserOptions.project` option. We do not do this by default for lint performance reasons.

rootProject.description: Create a application at the root of the workspace

minimal.description: Generate a React app with a minimal setup, no separate test files.
